qas.question: In which battle did the Dreyse needle gun gain its fame?
At the start of the Franco-Prussian War, what was the age of the Dreyse gun's design?
What was the Dreyse rifle's tactical range?
What was the name of the famous cannon issued to Prussian soldiers at the time?
What type of shell did the Krupp weapon fire?

context: The army was still equipped with the Dreyse needle gun of <a0_0>Battle of Königgrätz<a0_0/> fame, which was by this time showing the age of its <a1_0>25-year-old design<a1_0/>. The rifle had a range of only <a2_0>600 m (2,000 ft)<a2_0/> and lacked the rubber breech seal that permitted aimed shots. The deficiencies of the needle gun were more than compensated for by the famous <a3_0>Krupp<a3_0/> 6-pounder (3 kg) steel breech-loading cannons being issued to Prussian artillery batteries. Firing <a4_0>a contact-detonated shell<a4_0/>, the Krupp gun had a longer range and a higher rate of fire than the French bronze muzzle loading cannon, which relied on faulty time fuses.
